content: In the EOB profiles, what is the difference between "total" compared to "adjudication" (not item.adjudication). Both are at the level of the EOB (not the item) and have a slice for "adjudicationamountype" with "amount" cardinality 1.1.

can anyone address this question? The models are essentially the same except for the reason and value properties on elements of adjudication.
the descriptions in the guide don't do much to differentiate between them. Is it acceptable to simply duplicate the amounts between the two for a given adjudication type?
@Pat Taylor would you be able to explain the difference between total and adjudication at the EoB header level?

@jason chow Does this address your question? https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/carin-bb/branches/v0.1.8/StructureDefinition-C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Inpatient-Institutional.html#notes-on-fields

@Pat Taylor

i saw that yesterday. If you're referring to the statement "populate only if item.adjudication is not available", then i guess so. However that conflicts with the cardinality of the property. I guess the format of the IG doesn't enable accurately describing the relationship between eob.adjudication and eob.item.adjudication.
Would that be an accurate interpretation? @Saul Kravitz
@jason chow I'll take your answer as a "no" :smile: We (actually @Pat Taylor ) added the documentation with the intent of illuminating such questions, so thanks for the feedback.
@Saul Kravitz I appreciate the reply. Thanks!
@jason chow Could you please take a look at the current notes to see if your question is now addressed?
